intro: Plagiobothrys aurantiacus, commonly known as the orange globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, characterized by its showy, showy yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Plagiobothrys aurantiacus is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native range.
